languageKey.label: Database

In this section you can get an overview of your currently selected database compared to sql-files. You can also import sql-data directly into the database or upgrade tables from earlier versions of TYPO3.
Database host
Enter the hostname where the database server can be reached.
The hostname is a server where the database server is running. In most cases this will be "localhost".
Database username
Database password
TYPO3 database
Compare against default database
Reload static tables
Create default database tables
Please select a database dump
Execute
Write selected changes to database
Add fields
Change fields
Remove unused fields (rename with prefix)
Drop fields (really!)
Add tables
Remove unused tables (rename with prefix)
Drop tables (really!)

Table and field definitions should be updated!
There seems to be a number of differences between the database and the selected SQL-file. Please select which statements you want to execute in order to update your database:

Table and field definitions are OK.
The tables and fields in the current database correspond perfectly to the database in the selected SQL-file.
Check in the form below for which static table you want to load or reload the data. Be careful if the table already exists: it will be dropped before the data is loaded, so any changes will be lost.
Table "%s" was (re)created successfully and %d rows of data were loaded.
